meanings.definition: Capable of being avoided or prevented.
meanings.sent1: It is evitable to miss the bus if you leave early.
meanings.sent2: Wearing a helmet while biking makes head injuries evitable.
meanings.sent3: The cat found a way to make the evitable task of taking a bath impossible.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude made any negative outcome seem evitable.
meanings.sent5: By studying hard, she made failure evitable in her exams.

meanings.definition: Possible to be averted or sidestepped.
meanings.sent1: With careful planning, most conflicts are evitable.
meanings.sent2: Regular exercise and a healthy diet can make health issues evitable.
meanings.sent3: The magician's tricks made the evitable outcome of losing the game disappear.
meanings.sent4: His quick thinking made the evitable disaster seem like a distant memory.
meanings.sent5: The safety measures in place made accidents evitable in the workplace.
